intro: Ixora pulcherrima, commonly known as the flame-of-India, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, bright red or orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Ixora pulcherrima is also valued for its ability to produce fragrant flowers throughout the year.
